fields.description:
Hello,

It would be nice if SourceTree could support command line parameters as :

/repo "y:\my repo"

This would open SourceTree with the given repository opened.

It would allow me to use SourceTree instead of TortoiseHg with the automated tools I use at my workplace. This is the only issue for me to use it instead of TortoiseHg.

I have checked if this option is already available but I did not find anything about it.

Regards,

Sébastien FELDIS
fields.summary: Be able to open SourceTree on a given repo using a command line parameter

fields.description:
Due to fail login for a lot of time, captcha is required to login to Stash but SourceTree does not detect this captcha required when trying to add Stash repository to SourceTree.

SourceTree should detect this captcha required and should ask the user to login from Stash to remove the captcha.
fields.summary: Able to detect captcha required

fields.description:
When you have an unreliable internet connection, then Git copes with this well:

{code:none}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin  
fatal: unable to access 'https://github.com/jpluimers/jedi.git/': Failed connect to github.com:443; No error
    
Completed with errors, see above.
{code}

The Mercurial module just says "No changes to pull" after a long time, where I am sure there were changes (on the conference location, I could pull those changes).
fields.summary: Hg pull does not report connection errors correctly

fields.description:
On all other environments that I've used Source Tree (Windows 7, Windows Server Enterprise SP2) the commit nodes line up with the commit message.

On Windows Server 2012 the nodes are falling in between the commit messages.

I've attached two images, one from Windows 7 showing the expected alignment, and another from Windows Server 2012 showing the anomalous alignment.
fields.summary: Commit graph nodes not aligned with commit messages.

fields.description:
Hi,

I have a file with a string containing a "plus" symbol. When this "plus" is in the file, the diff tab show a weird result.
See first screen capture.
When I remove the "plus", diff is normal, see second screen capture.

I join the file too.

I tried to close and reopen ST, hit F5 several times, but without success.

(Sorry for the bad issue title but I don't know how to explain better this weird problem I encountered.)
fields.summary: Plus "+" symbol breaks diff

fields.description: Please consider adding a way to get spelling suggestions for commit messages. This can be implemented during your 'Fedex Delivery' days.
fields.summary: Commit message spelling corrections

fields.description: When you open the terminal, it would be useful to be able to paste commands copied from, say, a text editor.
fields.summary: Ability to Paste text into the Sourcetree terminal window

fields.description: Would be useful to have all team hosted repositories to clone.
fields.summary: Show team hosted repositories

fields.description: I can't see GIT repository local changes in tab "File Status" and in tab "Log/ History" when i select "Uncommited changes" in commits list. Changes apear at least when I Try to commit them in commit window.
fields.summary: No local changes visible

fields.description:
We have a default text encoding setting right now which is used as a fallback when we need to pre-configure the encoding or when we cannot determine the best encoding to use. This is currently defaulted to utf-8.

This works fine for file content, but there is a problem with extended characters on the file system, which are usually reported in the user's own codepage as defined by their regional settings. Ideally when we're calling commands which return or process file names, we should use the default file system code page that's in use. This means having 2 different default text encodings, one for text content and one for file names. The former should still be defaulted to utf-8, and the latter should be defaulted based on the user's OS regional settings.
fields.summary: Split default encoding into file system encoding and content encoding

fields.description:
We are using Git Flow with SourceTree.
At some point we archive old hotfixes and releases, effectively renaming remote branches from (eg.) hotfix/hotfix-for-foo to hotfix/archive/hotfix-for-foo

Right now we can only do this in a shell (using "git push origin :oldbranch" and pushing to the new archive remote).
I'd like to do that in SourceTree, the same as renaming local branches.

Showing a warning is useful ofcourse.
fields.summary: Rename remote branch

fields.description: When typing a commit message, it would be nice if there was some intellisense (auto complete) suggesting file names that are part of the commit.  For example if I am committing a change to the "test.txt" file, when I start typing "tes" in the commit message, an autocomplete box with "test.txt" should come up and if I tab, enter or click it, then it should insert that text.
fields.summary: Intellisense / Autocomplete based on contents of commit in commit message

fields.description:
I cannot seem to find how to do this in SourceTree, but this is dead easy in TortoiseHG with Beyond Compare as comparison/diff tool:

See the whole diff tree of a commit (local, in the push queue, or in the pull/fetch queue) in your external diff/comparison tool.

SourceTree should make this even easier than TortoiseHG
fields.summary: HG/Git: allow you to see the full diff of each commit

fields.description:
I cannot find (so if it is possible right now, it should be easier to do this):

in Mercurial mode, pull only certain commits from an upstream.

That allows you to pick and choose, or at least not pull until a certain commit that is known to be stable.
fields.summary: HG: Make it easy to pull only certain commits from a remote

fields.description: The button - "Terminal" is inactive if the bookmarklist is empty. I'd like to start the terminal even when no repository is listed.
fields.summary: Allow starting a terminal even when no repo has been created yet

fields.description: See http://mercurial.selenic.com/wiki/Phases for more information. Briefly say it very helps to manage the synchronisation with remote repositories.
fields.summary: Support for mercurial phase

fields.description: Adding a Stash hosted account, the button says "Change Password", but it actually seems to behave like a "Enter Password", in that even if someone already has a password and knows what it is, they still have to click this Change Password button.  Not really that intuitive.
fields.summary: Adding a hosted Stash account, the setting of password is not intuitive.

fields.description: It is important to know the history of a single file and then find commits that changes the file and diff the corresponding changes. I do not like jumping between gitk and sourcetree.
fields.summary: Viewing history of a single file and various commits that changed a file

fields.description:
Initialise Git Flow fails with:

sh.exe C:\Users\Neil\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow init -d
bash.exe: warning: could not find /tmp, please create!
"C:/Users/Neil/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/git_local/bin/sh.exe": C:\Users\Neil\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow: No such file or directory


Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Initialise Git Flow fails

fields.description: When performing some processes there are several steps involved.  Would it be possible to create a scripting process or workflow to allow for repeatable steps to be defined and processed as a set?
fields.summary: Scripting or Workflow

fields.description: When cloning a repository it would be helpful to browse on a git server to see what the repository names are.  Can a search option be added?
fields.summary: Browse enterprise git server

fields.description: When cloning a repository, it prompts for the Source Path / URL.  Once I have answered this for one of my project, can’t my choice remain “sticky”?
fields.summary: Source Path / URL - "sticky"

fields.description: When issuing a command, there is a checkbox to view details.  Some processes run so fast that you don’t have time to click on the box.  Sometimes it is desirable to see the detail output, even when there are no errors.  Can this choice be made “sticky” so I can watch a fast process in detail?
fields.summary: Show Full Output Checkbox - "sticky"

fields.description: Add the ability to initiate pull requests for locally-hosted github for enterprise instances. The link should be very similar to github.com
fields.summary: Enable extended integration with GitHub Enterprise

fields.description:
The application crashes on startup after update. It may have something to do with one mercurial project I'm have. Crash report dump file is too large and I can not attach it due to file size limit being 10Mb. The file weights 267Mb o.0

I tried deleting all atlassian folders in appdata\local and appdata\roaming
fields.summary: Crash on startup after upgrade to 1.2.2

fields.description: Summary pretty much covers it. toggled origin (under Remotes) closed, then toggled Remotes closed, and SourceTree crashed.
fields.summary: Clicked the toggle next to Remotes on the main view and app crashed.

fields.description: Please add Google Code to the list of supported hosting services.
fields.summary: Add Google Code hosting service

fields.description:
Crucible offer a command-line script to create reviews without having to open the Browser.

It would be good if this could be integrated into SourceTree via some action menu.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Creating+reviews+from+the+command+line
fields.summary: Integrate crucible.py script

fields.description:
It would be a nice addon for Atlassian users to be able to open the repository in the Browser in fisheye

https://crucible.xyz.com/browse/<my_repo>.git/

Other users may wish to view in ViewGit, Gitblit or Stash etc so these may be options too.
fields.summary: Add Action menu option to open Repostory in the Browser (Crucible/Fisheye)

fields.description:
First, thanks for this great tool.

I'm using Netbeans as an IDE but the Git plugin is a real mess, that's why I'm using SourceTree. However, the Git plugin in Netbeans is very well integrated and having to switch to SourceTree's window at each commit can be tiring. I've been thinking about global shortcuts for SourceTree, shortcuts working even though you're not in SourceTree. For instance, for the Commit command, the Committer window would appear on top of Netbeans (or any other software).

It could also be useful for any other IDE that doesn't integrate Git versioning natively.

Let me know what you think !
fields.summary: Add global shortcut to add/commit/push

fields.description:
(*r) VERY ANNOYING: cannot see which file has changed on each commit (*r)

First line of the files listview is blank (invisible) - only shows the file name+path if the list view is selected (ie now I need to click on the listview each time I consult my branches).
Occasionally is another line which is invisible
Affects listview in both "File Status" and "Log/History" tabs.
I wonder if this is caused by:
MultiSelectTreeView.cs/FocusHelper.cs ??? (changed 17 days ago)
fields.summary: First line of files listview is blank - only shows the (file name+path) if listview is clicked

fields.description:
SourceTree's diff view shows a lot of unwanted whitespace differences.  This slows the process of checking through the diff hunks before committing a file.

The problem seems worse when working with XAML files.

Whitespace differences can be filtered out easily in external tools; it would be great if SourceTree could do this too.

If you add this feature, please consider having separate options for "ignore changes to existing whitespace" and "ignore all whitespace".
fields.summary: Add "ignore whitespace" options for diff view

fields.description:
Hi,
I really love this tool.
I use it almost every day for my personal projects/work.

Have a request for a feature though (unless I overlooked existing features).

If there is a way to logically group the repositories in the left pane.
Because over a period of time the repositories added to Source tree can grow and the left pane that lists the repositories becomes a mess to scroll/navigate.

Having a grouping option, a user can create groups such as active/inactive/github/bitbucket etc.
fields.summary: Ability to Group Repositories in left pane

fields.description: For example: after a commit, the status window stays on the screen. Clicking the close button is often inconvenient. However, <esc> doesn't close said window. It'd be really nice if it would.
fields.summary: Make pressing <esc> close the various status windows instead of having to click [Close]

fields.description: When I check out a branch I would expect the new branch to be selected. But at the moment, the selection just remains at whatever it was before.
fields.summary: Checkout branch does not select the new branch
Crash upon app startup

fields.description:
It would be great if SourceTree would support Gitolite as an "Hosted Repositories" Service.

There are 2 ways to implement this.
1. parse output from ssh git@server info
As long as there are no changes to default output this should work.

2. and more stable 
use a custom gitolite command to retrive all information needed.
fields.summary: Gitolite as Hosted Repositories

fields.description: The option to check default remotes for updates every X minutes is extremely usefuly, unless you're looking at a specific commit while it refreshes. If you're looking through commits and a refresh happens, it's liable to deselect the commit, file, and point in the diff you were looking at and scroll you back up to the top of the log.
fields.summary: Check default remotes for updates every X minutes refreshes everything.

fields.description: When discarding a Hunk or File in a compressed directory where the original file is Compressed, SourceTree creates them uncompressed.
fields.summary: In a compressed directory, new files are created compressed
click Show Hosted Repo crash

fields.description:
When double clicking on the graph header, the column resizes to a width just wide enough for 3 branches.

When double clicking again, the full-width of the graph is visible overlaid on top of the Description column.
fields.summary: Graph Column does not resize when double clicked.

fields.description:
When I commit changes to a local branch that is tracking a branch on stash, it is not displaying the indicator showing that I have changes that need to be pushed. I marked this as Major, as this will cause people to forget to push code up into develop after they do a hot fix, causing major merge issues. 

I have also attached a screen shot (edited to preserve confidential information), that shows what I am seeing. 

Thank you for your help, David. 

Also, when I put the version number into the Affects Version, it said version 1.1.1 does not exist, even when I selected it from the list.
fields.summary: Not displaying push icon

fields.description: From the "File" menu, I select "Setup Wizard" and fill in the basic elements. Upon clicking the "Finish" button, the application crashes. A similar crash occurs when clicking the "Show Hosted Repositories" button.
fields.summary: Crash after clicking "Finish" in setup wizard

fields.description:
Steps:
1) Pressed Commit button to start a commit.
2) In the resulting commit dialog, I created a comment that began with: [WIN]
Once the commit finished, the GUI updated and showed the attached error message.  At this point, the Log/History tab only showed 'Uncommitted changes'...the rest of the log wasn't there. Because of the log error, I figured the issue was with the all caps or the square brackets.
3) Clicked on Terminal button to bring up a terminal
4) Executed: git commit --amend -m "[Win] rest of message"
This resulted in the same error and Log/History view.
6) Executed: git commit --amend -m "Win: rest of message"
This fixed the issue.  The Log/History was populated.
fields.summary: Commit message causes 'git log' failed with code128 message.

fields.description: After updating it crashed on launch until removing bookmarks.xml file.
fields.summary: Crash after 1.2.0.0 update

fields.description: Upgraded from 1.1.(something, I forgot) to 1.2.0 this morning.  When I attempt to start SourceTree, it crashes immediately and produces the attached log.
fields.summary: SourceTree 1.2.0 crashes immediately on startup

fields.description: Application crashes at startup.  After updating to the new version which was pushed to me, SourceTree crashes on application loading. Error log is attached.
fields.summary: Application crashes at startup

fields.description:
I use Vb like programming language, this IDE changes my code files automaticaly, but It isn't important, SourceTree must have a option to configure this to ignore the uppercase or lowercase changes, like another diff viewers like Winmerge

This is a really critical problem because Sorcetree shows files with changes that I don't touch

Thanks.

Regards
fields.summary: Ignore uppercase or lowercase changes

fields.description:
Sometime one long line of code has only one character that changed, but in the current compare I cannot tell which one, it looks like two identical lines and I must go over each character one by one to see which one was changed.
Can this be improved to reflect the behavior on GitHub for example?
Thanks!
fields.summary: Highlight also different characters, not only lines in code compare

fields.description:
When viewing the Working Copy, I highlight multiple files to commit, right-click, select "Commit...".  The commit window appears with only the appropriate files checked, but all available changes or new files visible.  Occasionally, the window will refresh automatically, and select all files that are visible in the commit window.  This can be annoying when there are a lot of unversioned files visible.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Navigate to the appropriate repository
# Select "Working Copy"
# Highlight multiple files, but not all 
# Right-click the highlighted files, and select "Commit..."
** The commit window appears with the appropriate files selected
# Wait until the commit window automatically refreshes
** All files are now selected

Note: This is not consistent behavior, as in, I do not see it occurring every time I open the commit window, but it does seem to happen fairly regularly.
Note 2: In a specific instance, I did not see the behavior happening until I started to type a comment.  Then the window refreshed and all files were selected.
fields.summary: Commit Window Can Refresh and Select ALL Files

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Clone repository from an Atlassian Stash server.
2. Right click on the new repository in the bookmarks panel.

Expected results: menu actions are available for use.
What happens: Show in explorer and other menu actions are disabled (grayed out).
fields.summary: Bookmarks Context menu entries disabled on newly cloned repository.

fields.description:
Got a merge conflict in my {{pom.xml}} files and tried resolve conflict in SourceTree (Windows 1.1.1.0) using 'Use Theirs'.

When I checked the Stage I could see it left the start conflict end conflict markers in the file:

{code:xml}
    <modules>
 
        <module>mod-a</module>
 
<<<<<<< HEAD
 
        <module>mod-b</module>
 
=======
 
        <module>mod-c</module>
 
        <module>mod-d</module>        
 
>>>>>>> 6e703d8... comment
 
    </modules>
{code}
fields.summary: Resolve using theirs leaves >> conflict markers for XML files

fields.description:
As we do have delivered software in different versions and have to support older versions of our software, it would be helpful to have the "git flow support" command available via Sourcetree. (Creating branches from master when you have to support an older version of the software)

(see: https://github.com/nvie/gitflow / https://github.com/nvie/gitflow/blob/develop/git-flow-support / http://yakiloo.com/getting-started-git-flow/)
fields.summary: "git flow support"

fields.description:
Double clicked the source tree icon and received an error to report the issue.  If I run SourceTree as Administrator it works fine.  Only recently had this problem after updating SourceTree.
I have uninstalled and reinstalled and also removed SourceTree from ProgramData after the 2nd uninstall.  Same problem persists.

I have assumed from the log file that a Git repository doesn't have the correct permissions which is why it runs as Administrator, however, I have checked the permissions on the Git repository and it has the correct permissions.
fields.summary: Crash on startup

fields.description:
Browsing through the DUnitX .git repository to the DUnitXML subrepository, SourceTree crashed while doing some background work.

In the background it was doing some work on the Mercurial repository called BeSharpNet.

It tried to do this patch on a file with unicode characters in the filename (also in the patch; I can provide more details about the repos: they are all public):

diff --git a/2013/20130907-RAD-Studio-In-Action-PasCon-Leiden-Netherlands/A successful Git branching model � nvie.com.url b/2013/20130907-RAD-Studio-In-Action-PasCon-Leiden-Netherlands/A successful Git branching model � nvie.com.url
--- a/2013/20130907-RAD-Studio-In-Action-PasCon-Leiden-Netherlands/A successful Git branching model � nvie.com.url	
+++ b/2013/20130907-RAD-Studio-In-Action-PasCon-Leiden-Netherlands/A successful Git branching model � nvie.com.url	
@@ -0,0 +1,2 @@
+[InternetShortcut]
+URL=http://nvie.com/posts/a-successful-git-branching-model/
fields.summary: SourceTree just crashed on me, probably when doing a patch in the background on a file that has a unicode character in the filename

fields.description:
As mentioned above, I want to use SourceTree Git with a BitBucket repository. I often have to work in a network with proxy and authentification. The only way to get these parts to work together I've found so far is to change an ~/.gitconfig file. I would really appreciate a built-in option that let's you enter a proxy and a username/password. Examples with the wanted options I regularly use are Mozilla Firefox, Skype and Dropbox.
Thanks a lot
Lukas Leitinger
fields.summary: Proxy Implementation

fields.description: Typing and backspacing in the Gitflow New feature dialogue it shows a graphical preview of the new branch, but the drawn branch name lags really badly behind what's been typed, backspacing and retyping and it's sometimes 10 seconds behind what's been typed.
fields.summary: Drawing of new branch preview in Gitflow new feature lags badly

fields.description:
the right click menu in the pending files list is not consitent across the two platforms

also the choice of word 'discard' seems to be a mild source of confusion for those I have introduced to SourceTree - specifically 'revert' is pretty much the standard term and should be the menu option label for both platforms I think...

i've been asked a few times now "how do i do a revert?" only to reach the desk and find a user staring at that drop down menu and not wanting to try 'Discard' out of fear that it will be destructive and irreversible.
fields.summary: 'Discard' in Windows, 'Revert' in Mac

fields.description:
when trying to commit changes to some > 256 files (i don't know the exact number but at least one in each folder that was labelled 0..FF in hex) I was unable to do it - the commit would error with no visible error message.

However, selecting a few files at a time and committing them I was able to commit every outstanding change just fine.

(could this be a variation on the classic 'string or array is a large fixed size when should be dynamically allocated' problem?)
fields.summary: Some kind of limit on number of files that can be handled in a single action

fields.description: Please add an option to squash the commits for the merge dialog equivalent to "git merge --squash".
fields.summary: Allow squash option for merges

fields.description: As options in SourceTree, it would be useful to have greater access to the Git option set. Start with --allow-empty for the Git commit command.
fields.summary: Allow empty commits in Git

fields.description:
In a mercurial repository commit something with a commit message containing special caracters (é, è, à...)
The commit dialog has no problem displaying them, but once committed, they appear as 2 strange characters (for example : é => Ã©) in the log/history view.
fields.summary: Commit messages are incorrectly displayed

fields.description:
The program crash when I tried to push my commit to the server.
I just press on the push commit, I didn't even validate the form for the push.

Here is the log file ...

Tks for your help =)
fields.summary: Crash when try to push

fields.description:
SourceTree will convert a whole file from CR-LF (win) to LF (linux) if you use the "Discard Selected Lines" function for a CR-LF file on Windows.

Reproduce:
- Under Windows, create an ANSI file with CR-LF ending and check it into your repository.
- Modify a single line (or multiple lines) inside an external editor (notepad++).
- Select some lines of this file inside SourceTree and chose "Discard selected Lines"

Result:
- The whole file will be converted to LF and for this marked as 100% modified.
fields.summary: Undesired conversion of line endings of whole file when discarding selected lines (CR-LF to LF)

fields.description:
We have a large project, which is split into > 20 Git repositories containing different modules of the system. Depending on the part a developer is working on, he will have local clones of 10-15 repositories.

It would be extremely handy (and time saving), when the commands for push, pull, tag, branch and checkout can work on a group of bookmarked repositories, either by a multi-select option, or by using the operation on a bookmark folder.

This way the developer can quickly switch between develop, release and feature branches. At the moment we can only use command line scripts to accommodate this.
fields.summary: Add multi-select option to push/pull/tag/branch/checkout

fields.description:
1, On Mac platform, I can hide/unhide the toolbar of sourcetree, and many softwares on the Windows platform allow users to hide/unhide the toolbar. I think it is a good design because most of time we want to focus on the main pane. And the toolbar of SourceTree for Windows is too big for me.

2, It's a nice feature to allow users customize the toolbar. Some friends want to rearrange the shortcuts, or hide texts under the icons to save space and make the UI more concise/elegant.
fields.summary: Hide/Unhide toolbar and customize toolbar
Object reference not set to an instance of an object.

fields.description: Since a few updates ago, everytime I switch from SourceTree to another application and then switch back to SourceTree the program freezes (clicking the window adds "Not responding" to the window title) for a solid 5 seconds. After that the program is working normally until I focus on another window. This makes working with the software incredibly annoying.
fields.summary: SourceTree freezes for five seconds after regaining focus

fields.description:
GitFlow feature:

* New local feature branch created by GitFlow feature
* Some commits into feature branch
* GitFlow/Finish Feature

Regardles of value in "Rebase on development branch" checbox is feature allways merged.

Maybe better choice is to remove "Rebase on development branch" checbox from the Finish Feature form to follow gitflow rules.
fields.summary: GitFlow: Cannot rebase feature into development branch

fields.description: See SRCTREE-786 for more details and implementation discussion.
fields.summary: Mercurial Queues Extension ( hg mq )

fields.description:
everytime i start srctree it asks me to enter password for git private key. smartgit can remember this password (there is a checkbox in the dialog) and it does not popup console of ssh for password input.

this is productivity feature and it will be great if srctree has this kind of feature similar to smartgit
fields.summary: remember ssh password

fields.description: Would be useful to have a copy path to clipboad on right-clicking repositories. Handy for setting-up remote repositories.
fields.summary: Add "Copy Path to Clipboard" for repositories

fields.description:
The graph of the branches looks odd:
 Commit circles are a half row up as you can see in this screenshot I've attached.



*Workaround*
{color:#172b4d} Change to a theme other than {color}*Aero.Lite*
fields.summary: Branches graph seems off

fields.description:
I have an pre-existing source folder that I wanted to add to sourcetree.
I created a hg repository inside it and started adding files.
The few files that are accented in this repository are incorrectly displayed (accents->diamond with interrogation mark inside). Note that those filenames are correctly displayed in windows explorer....

I can't add those files to the repository either, this is the error message :
hg remove -y -f AnnuaireSRVFlex\src\probtp\pict\R�initialiser.gif
not removing AnnuaireSRVFlex\src\probtp\pict\R�initialiser.gif: file is untracked

Completed with errors, see above.


Using 'hg add' from sourcetree's terminal works (files are added to the repo), but character display in hg status is wrong too (accented 'e' is converted to accented 'u').

Committing at this point (with a few accented files added through 'hg add') doesn't seem to bring further issues.
fields.summary: Default encoding for calls which return file names to OS encoding

fields.description:
I have SourceTree pinned in the taskbar on Windows 8.
After Auto updating the pinned icon gets broken in the taskbar. I have to manually unpin the broken icon, then pin it again.
All recent versions (since 0.9.x)
To reproduce
1. Open SourceTree
2. Pin SourceTree (right click the icon) in the taskbar (desktop mode)
3. Update SourceTree. It will automatically restart with the new version.
4. Pinned icon (shortcut) gets broken, although it is still highlighted as running.
5. If SourceTree is closed, the icon is no longer pointing to the new installation.

I have to unpin, then pin again while it is still running, else if I close it, next time I have to search for it in Windows 8 "userfriendly" UI to run it (or pin it).

Although it is a minor bug, it is annoying.
fields.summary: Pinned taskbar icon gets broken after auto-updating (Windows 8)

fields.description: Information about remotes not refresh and there is no prune action for remotes. May you add this action or prune remotes automaticaly on refresh?
fields.summary: Prune remotes on refresh

fields.description:
In a repository where the parent of a commit is newer than the commit itself, Sourcetree does not display the parent of the commit properly when "date order" is selected (using topological order will display the repository correctly).

The reason for this is that the parent appears higher up in the commit history. However, the line that is shown suggests that the parent is yet to come. This is misleading. The line should stop with a particular marker or something (e.g. ending in an x).
fields.summary: Improve History When Using Date Order in Repositories With Inserted Commits

fields.description: It would be nice to have a progress bar to show the progresses of the pushing operation, especially for big pushings.
fields.summary: Display percentage while pushing.

fields.description:
The Git/Mercurial-Downloader does not work (I think its because of our company-internal firewall-virus-scanner). The solution would be: use HTTPS. To use HTTPS would be beneficial anyway.

One more thing: if I directly view the URL I get this message: "The item you have requested is infected by a virus. It will not be downloaded." May indeed be a false alarm - or?
fields.summary: File downloader not working

fields.description:
I'm using bookmarks to organize multiple heads of my branches. This is an issue with SourceTree because every head is shown (indistinguishably) as an extra branch (with the same name).

One way to solve this would be to show the heads on a second level:

{code:none}
- branches
    - default
        - head-1
        - head-2 
    - other-branch
        - head-1
{code}
fields.summary: Distinguish multiple heads more clearly in sidebar

fields.description: Mercurial's concept of a remote is called path
fields.summary: Change "Remotes" for "Paths" in Mercurial repositories

fields.description:
It took a while for WPF to get the text rendering right. WPF 3.5 rendered text "naturally", i.e. it disregarded the physical pixel layout in favor of ideal proportionality. This is very much unlike the traditional GDI approach for rendering which tries to align letters with pixels as much as possible, thereby gaining sharpness and clarity at the cost of slight proportional inaccuracies.

While one can argue in favor of the "ideal" rendering scheme of WPF 3.5 in word processors and layouting software, font fidelity is only a minor issue in traditional UI, and the focus should be put on clarity. Thus, when VS 2010 started to use WPF to render its UI, a new option was added to switch text rendering between "Ideal" and "Display" mode: "Ideal" retains the behavior of WPF 3.5 whereas "Display" is very close to GDI's font rendering and improves screen legibility a lot. But unfortunately the "Ideal" mode is still the default in WPF 4.0!

The SourceTree UI is percieved as blurry in terms of text rendering by me and others, e.g. the guy who wrote this report:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-609
The reason is that SourceTree, despite being a WPF 4.0 application, still uses the WPF 3.5 "Ideal" rendering mode. The attached screenshots prove this: the left image was taken from unmodified SourceTree, but then I used Snoop (http://snoopwpf.codeplex.com/) to change the TextOptions.TextFormattingMode property of the Window to "Display" at runtime, which results in the much clearer font rendering in the right image.

To fix this, simply add
{{TextOptions.TextFormattingMode="Display"}}
to the properties of all the windows in the project.

For more information, please read http://karlshifflett.wordpress.com/2009/10/22/much-improved-net-4-0-wpf-text-rendering/ and http://blogs.msdn.com/b/text/archive/2009/08/24/wpf-4-0-text-stack-improvements.aspx .
fields.summary: Improve blurry WPF text rendering
Checkout of files/directories in stash

fields.description: When I upgraded to latest version 1.8 my ssh key was erased not a huge deal, but also when I tried to push to origin there was no prompt warning me that there was an invalid or no ssh key. I discovered the issue by checking full output and realizing that it was just stuck at the welcome message of the connection server.
fields.summary: SSH key removed on app update

fields.description:
Some days ago I noticed that the code in hunks aren't respecting the encoding of the files, utf-8. If i change the encoding of the file to ANSI, the modification (the green part) appears right.

I tried to modify the configuration of encoding (tools -> options -> default text encoding) to something else and back to utf-8, but the issue remains. I tried to uninstall and reinstall, too.

This issue prevents me of stage lines, too.

I have gitHub for Windows installed too and everything looks fine on it.
fields.summary: ANSI instead of utf-8

fields.description: I created a repository fine. I then went to create a branch called "Main" and it crashed and has not been able to restart.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crash

fields.description:
If the terminal opened as a pane:

* Context could change depending on the tab
* Refresh could be emitted upon executing commands
* Would not need to have an additional window

This could be a very nice UI improvement
fields.summary: Open terminal as a pane

fields.description: Bitbucket issue tracking from the desktop would be really handy
fields.summary: Issue tracking

fields.description:
To reproduce, in the File Status View :
1. Press F5 to refresh ST
2. The panel at the right is showing changes of the first file of the Working Copy Changes list
3. Order files in Working Copy Changes by "Path" column
4. Select another file
5. ==> The right panel keep showing previously selected file changes.

This way we can always reproduce the bug, but it can occurs in some other ways.
fields.summary: On using list order, changes preview panel keep showing previously selected file changes

fields.description:
When using right click > Remove on a file in the File Status View, SourceTree delete another file randomly in my project.

This occurs two times, first time I thought it was a mistake by me, and the delete file was easy to recover. Second time it delete a file I worked on, the modifications on this file were not commited and I loose lots of work...

For the moment it occurs when I "remove" non-versionned files.
fields.summary: ST delete a random file in the project when using "Remove" command on another file

fields.description:
Can not display utf-8 non-asscii characters in internal diff view.
This error is only occurred when I update sourcetree to version 1.1.0.0.
This is a view error only:
+ The file is still encoded correctly
+ External Diff is correctly
+ occur in both git & hg repositories
fields.summary: internal diff view: can not display utf-8 non-asscii characters

fields.description:
Currently, if a repository has a dirty submodule, SourceTree goes through this workflow:

1. Open the commit dialog for the superproject
2. Stage your superproject changes and click Commit
3. The submodule check window appears.
4. Click "Open" on the submodule and commit the change
5. Return to the superproject and click "Refresh".
6. The superproject commit continues automatically WITHOUT staging the new submodule commit

I think the submodule check screen should not continue automatically; it should return to the superproject's commit dialog and allow the user to stage their change to the submodule. This will help prevent forgetting to commit the submodule's new checkout. If the user really wants to ignore the dirty submodule, they should click "Skip".
fields.summary: Return to the commit dialog after prompting to update submodules

fields.description:
I made changes which also caused changes to be made to files in a submodule I am referencing. In SourceTree I opened up the view for the submodule, and clicked on a file  in the "Working Copy Changes" pane. I then pressed the down key to go to the next file and the application crashed. From the log file:
2013-08-28T14:19:45: Fatal error: 
System.InvalidOperationException: Operation is not valid due to the current state of the object.

2013-08-28T14:19:45: Stack trace: 
   at SourceTree.View.Utils.ScrollableTabPanel.LineDown()
   at System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer.ExecuteNextCommand()
   at System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer.OnLayoutUpdated(Object sender, EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.ContextLayoutManager.fireLayoutUpdateEvent()
   at System.Windows.ContextLayoutManager.UpdateLayout()
   at System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer.OnKeyDown(KeyEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeHandler(Delegate handler, Object target)
   at System.Windows.EventRoute.InvokeHandlersImpl(Object source, RoutedEventArgs args, Boolean reRaised)
   at System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEventImpl(DependencyObject sender, RoutedEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseTrustedEvent(RoutedEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.Input.InputManager.ProcessStagingArea()
   at System.Windows.Input.InputManager.ProcessInput(InputEventArgs input)
   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndKeyboardInputProvider.ReportInput(IntPtr hwnd, InputMode mode, Int32 timestamp, RawKeyboardActions actions, Int32 scanCode, Boolean isExtendedKey, Boolean isSystemKey, Int32 virtualKey)
   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndKeyboardInputProvider.ProcessKeyAction(MSG& msg, Boolean& handled)
   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.CriticalTranslateAccelerator(MSG& msg, ModifierKeys modifiers)
   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.OnPreprocessMessage(Object param)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
fields.summary: Application crashed when browsing through list of changed files in submodule

fields.description:
If Proxy Password included "@" mark, 
Proxy hostname became not resolved name. 
because that proxy password is not escaped of @ mark.
fields.summary: Proxy host name can be broken.

fields.description:
I think it would be great to be able to sort the tags listed in the sidebar, for instance, by tag creation date.

This would help me much finding the right tag.
fields.summary: Allow to order tags in the sidebar
